diskUtilities

Class Directory

  • java.lang.Object
    • diskUtilities.Directory

  • public class Directory
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the necessary methods to achieve recursive removal
    Author:
    Israel J.Lopez Toledo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Directory() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> createList(int inodeIndex, DiskUnit d)
      Creates an array list with every name that the directory provided contains
      void deleteDir(java.lang.String name, DiskUnit d)
      Removes target directory from current directory and disk (works exactly like the RemoveDirectoryProcessor in the SystemCommandsProcessor class)
      void deleteFile(java.lang.String name, DiskUnit d)
      Removes target file from current directory and disk (works exactly like the RemoveFileProcessor in the SystemCommandsProcessor class)
      void deleteFiles(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> files, DiskUnit d, int inodeDir, int currentDir)
      Travels recursively through every non empty directory.
      int findFile(java.lang.String name, DiskUnit d)
      Finds target directory or file inode index
      boolean isDirectory(java.lang.String name, DiskUnit d)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Directory

        public Directory()

    • Method Detail

      • deleteFiles

        public void deleteFiles(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> files,
                        DiskUnit d,
                        int inodeDir,
                        int currentDir)
        Travels recursively through every non empty directory. First it verifies if content of directory is file or directory. If it is a directory it verifies if it is empty, if it is empty it deletes it, if it is not empty the method calls itself. If it is a file it simply deletes it
        Parameters:
        files - an array list with the content of the current directory the method is verifying
        d - an instance of the current disk
        inodeDir - inode index of the next directory the method is moving to
        currentDir - inode index of the previous directory

      • deleteFile

        public void deleteFile(java.lang.String name,
                       DiskUnit d)
        Removes target file from current directory and disk (works exactly like the RemoveFileProcessor in the SystemCommandsProcessor class)
        Parameters:
        name - name of the target file to remove
        d - an instance of the current disk

      • deleteDir

        public void deleteDir(java.lang.String name,
                      DiskUnit d)
        Removes target directory from current directory and disk (works exactly like the RemoveDirectoryProcessor in the SystemCommandsProcessor class)
        Parameters:
        name - name of the target directory to remove
        d - an instance of the current disk

      • isDirectory

        public boolean isDirectory(java.lang.String name,
                           DiskUnit d)
        Verifies if target is file or directory
        Parameters:
        name - name of the target to determine if it is directory or file
        d - an instance of the current disk
        Returns:
        true if file is directory, false otherwise

      • findFile

        public int findFile(java.lang.String name,
                    DiskUnit d)
        Finds target directory or file inode index
        Parameters:
        name - name of the target to find
        d - an instance of the current disk
        Returns:
        target directory or file inode index, return -1 if file is not found

      • createList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> createList(int inodeIndex,
                                                        DiskUnit d)
        Creates an array list with every name that the directory provided contains
        Parameters:
        inodeIndex - inode index of the directory from which the list will be created
        d - an instance of the current disk
        Returns:
        array list with every content of the directory
